row_col_operator package

Submodules

row_col_operator.row_col_operator module

class row_col_operator.row_col_operator.RowColOperator[source]

Bases: object

This class operate row and column in worksheet of Excel.

check_my_value_col()[source]

Check my value to determine able to get end column in target sheet. This function is for internal use only.

Parameters

Nothing. –

Returns

If able to get end col, return True.

Return type

bool

check_my_value_row()[source]

Check my value to determine able to get end row in target sheet. This function is for internal use only.

Parameters

Nothing. –

Returns

If able to get end row, return True.

Return type

bool

get_end_col() → int[source]

This function gets end column in target worksheet. If target row values are all None, return 1.

Note

The bellow variable must be set value before this function call. self.__ws, self.__target_row

Parameters

Nothing. –

Returns

End column of the specified column in target worksheet. If target row values are all None, return 1.

Return type

int

Examples

In case end column of 16th column is 4.

>>> print(row_col_operator.get_end_col())
4

row_col_operator = RowColOperator()
row_col_operator.set_ws = openpyxl.load_workbook('workbook_name')['worksheet_name']
row_col_operator.set_target_row = 16
print(row_col_operator.get_end_col())
get_end_row() → int[source]

This function gets end row in target worksheet. If target column values are all None, return 1.

Note

The bellow variable must be set value before this function call. self.__ws, self.__target_col

Parameters

Nothing. –

Returns

End row of the specified column in target worksheet. If target column values are all None, return 1.

Return type

int

Examples

In case end row of 3rd column is 15.

>>> print(row_col_operator.get_end_row())
15

row_col_operator = RowColOperator()
row_col_operator.set_ws = openpyxl.load_workbook('workbook_name')['worksheet_name']
row_col_operator.set_target_col = 3
print(row_col_operator.get_end_row())
